Posts.Content: Apr 27, 2008 12:56AM jas wrote: HI Twigwin- Thanks and Love your quote! Day 10 after 1st TC treatment and finally feeling better! Nixne on the claritin - It was recommended to continue tylenol or take aleve or some  advil - up to 600 mg. We're having lovely *almost southern cal* weather here in New England!
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Aug 6, 2008 03:35PM jas wrote: Wish I had this list before my chemo ( 4 cytoxan/taxotere) - it is terrific!!! I would just add that the only thing that helped my metallic taste was ginger ale - and it was the only way to keep hydrated although water with a lemon slice was okay. I definitely second biotene for mouthwash. The sites for the wigs - including someone mentioning ebay are a great help - I never did find those sites. I am on to radiation (35 sessions)  and herceptin weekly. Thanks to all for the list !
Posts.Title: More Tips (and a Shopping List) for Getting Through Chemo rock MinusTwo

Posts.Content: Apr 16, 2008 04:03PM - edited Apr 16, 2008 04:05PM by jas Hi everyone... I will be starting my chemo tomorrow. Love to join you all and keep up our spirits and fight! I have gone through a lumpectomy and 3 ( YES 3 ) re-excisions for invasive and dcis- from 1/25-3/7 this year. Glad that is over! Now going to cytoxan and taxotere for 4 doses every three weeks then herceptin for a year. My onc did let me know beforehand about the constipation. I am hoping for the best...   Dx: 1/5/08, T 1.5, N0, M0, er/pr +, her2neu +
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Apr 23, 2008 11:25PM jas wrote: Hello all - It's been a tough week with the first round of chemo I have to say... the decadron made me loopey! The chemo itself went in fine - no problems. The neulasta gave me mod. bone pain to say the least and still having it five days later... thank goodness for ginger ale, lemons, tums, compazine, tylenol, and zofran. All needed and taken and appreciated! This from one that hates to take any pill etc all my life and I'm turning 51 on Friday. Thanks for all your support. Got a short hair cut to look like my wig. Not sure why having insomnia last night and tonight?... see my onc tomorrow -
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27
